etymology.description: 日(日) (rì, "sun") and 本(本) (běn, "origin") together signify Japan as the "origin of the sun." This reflects the geographical position of Japan east of the Asian continent, where the sun rises.
etymology.interpretation: Japan is called 日本 because it is located to the east of the Asian mainland, where the sun rises, symbolizing the "origin of the sun."

examples.chinese: 我今年计划去日本(我今年計劃去日本)，体验当地文化(體驗當地文化)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jīnnián jìhuà qù Rìběn, tǐyàn dāngdì wénhuà.
examples.english: I plan to go to Japan this year, to experience the local culture.

examples.chinese: 日本美食吸引众多游客(日本美食吸引眾多遊客)。
